channel.title: Java Programming Beginners
channel.description:
I dont know if this is the right place to post so if it its sorry and please move (:
Ok so now I was just bored and decided to make a little tutorial on basics of java programming! I have a feeling that people are going to be saying bad stuff about this but I dont care. Im just doing this to HELP people out who are new. I know that this is very little and BASIC but it gives them an idea of what Java Programming is like.
Hope this helps!! :D
[code]public class MyRsps {
public static void main (String[] args) { System.out.println("My first Rsps code"); System.out.println("I love Java"); }
}[/code]
This line of code names the class and either makes it public to people or not [code]public class MyRsps {[/code]
[code]public[/code] means that it is public so everybody can access it
[code]class[/code] This is a class In object-oriented programming, a class is a construct that is used as a blueprint to create instances of itself referred to as class instances, class objects, instance objects or simply objects
[code]MyRsps[/code] This is the name of the class
[code]{[/code] you need a bracket all the time after you name your class
This line names the METHOD [code]public static void main (String[] args) {[/code]
[code]public[/code] yet again so anyone can access
[code]static[/code] static means that the variable or method marked as such is available at the class level. In other words, you don't need to create an instance of the class to access it. But this is a little more advanced for beginners
[code]void[/code] it's a mandatory option in this case otherwise there should be a 'return' at the end of the method. the main which is giving the project entry point is a typical 'no return' method.
[code]main[/code] Name of the method
[code](String[] args)[/code] This method must be given an array of Strings and the array is called "args"
[code]{[/code] Another open bracket of the method
[code]System.out.println[/code] This tells the computer to print to standard output (it defaults to command-line)
[code]("My First Rsps Code")[/code] This is the string you want to print
[code];[/code] Every statement ends with a semicolon to end the statement!
[code]System.out.println("I love Java");[/code] Is the same thing as above
[code]}[/code] Closing bracket of the main method
[code]}[/code] Closing bracket of the class name (MyRsps)
I could do another tutorial on what you can do in the main method but at the moment I am to lazy to do! If you appreciate and would like me to I would gladly! :D
I hope this is some what good info for you beginners!
Also the FASTEST way to learn is to go to the library or store and get a Java Programming book! It teaches you everything you need to know! Thats how I learned and probably most people!
REP++ would be appreciated :D

Updated Post explained a little more of “void” and “class”

item.title: Java Programming Beginners
item.dc:creator: @Native1 Native^
item.description:
@Native1 wrote:

“This is a class lol”
…
Noobs don’t know what a class is.

“The return type. Void means there is no return value”
Noobs also don’t know what a ‘return value’ is.

Explain it.

Read full topic

item.title: Java Programming Beginners
item.dc:creator: @Daginith Daginith
item.description:
@Daginith wrote:

very nice explanation.

Although you only teach people how to echo text, You should add on to that by teaching about arrays and switch() functions, and simple data types (int,double, char, boolean…ect).

Read full topic

item.title: Java Programming Beginners
item.dc:creator: @robonick8 robonick8
item.description:
@robonick8 wrote:

I dont know if this is the right place to post so if it its sorry and please move (:

Ok so now I was just bored and decided to make a little tutorial on basics of java programming!
I have a feeling that people are going to be saying bad stuff about this but I dont care.
Im just doing this to HELP people out who are new. I know that this is very little and BASIC but it gives them an idea of what Java Programming is like.

Hope this helps!!

[code]public class MyRsps {

         public static void main (String[] args) {
             System.out.println("My first Rsps code");
             System.out.println("I love Java");
        }

}[/code]

This line of code names the class and either makes it public to people or not

means that it is public so everybody can access it

This is a class
In object-oriented programming, a class is a construct that is used as a blueprint to create instances of itself referred to as class instances, class objects, instance objects or simply objects

This is the name of the class

you need a bracket all the time after you name your class

This line names the METHOD

yet again so anyone can access

static means that the variable or method marked as such is available at the class level. In other words, you don’t need to create an instance of the class to access it. But this is a little more advanced for beginners

it’s a mandatory option in this case otherwise there should be a ‘return’ at the end of the method.
the main which is giving the project entry point is a typical ‘no return’
method.

Name of the method

This method must be given an array of Strings and the array is called “args”

Another open bracket of the method

This tells the computer to print to standard output (it defaults to command-line)

This is the string you want to print

Every statement ends with a semicolon to end the statement!

Is the same thing as above

Closing bracket of the main method

Closing bracket of the class name (MyRsps)

I could do another tutorial on what you can do in the main method but at the moment I am to lazy to do! If you appreciate and would like me to I would gladly!

I hope this is some what good info for you beginners!

Also the FASTEST way to learn is to go to the library or store and get a Java Programming book! It teaches you everything you need to know! Thats how I learned and probably most people!

REP++ would be appreciated
